    • Constructor Detail

      • SqsConsumerBuilder

        public SqsConsumerBuilder(SqsConsumerManager manager,
                          SqsQueue<T> sqsQueue,
                          ConsumerHandler<T> consumerHandler)
        Parameters:
        manager - A SqsConsumerManager that manages interactions between all of the consumers
        sqsQueue - The sqsQueue
        consumerHandler - A handler used to process a message. The number of current messages being processed by the handler is limited by `numPermits`. You *MUST* either `ack()` or `nack()` EVERY message using the provided MessageAcknowledger to allow more messages to be processed.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public SqsConsumer<T> build()

      • withNumPermits

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withNumPermits(int numPermits)
        Parameters:
        numPermits - Max number of concurrent requests this consumer can process. A permit is consumed when the handler is called, and released when the message is acked or nacked.

      • withAutoExpire

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withAutoExpire(boolean autoExpire)
        Parameters:
        autoExpire - Enable/Disable auto expire. If this is enabled, when an sqs message reaches it's visibility timeout, and hasn't been acked yet, it will automatically call ignore() on the acknowledger. Default autoExpire is false.

      • withBufferSize

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - size of the consumer messageBuffer. Ideally this should be slightly higher than the number of messages that can be processed by this consumer in the amount of time needed to do an HTTP round-trip to SQS. If this value is too low, performance may be lower than expected since a small messageBuffer size limits the number of possible in-flight SQS requests. If you use a value significantly too large, messages may start to reach their visibilityTimeout before processing finishes causing duplicate messages. The maximum number of in-flight HTTP requests is limited to max(1, floor(maxQueueSize/10))

      • withBackoffStrategy

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withBackoffStrategy(BackoffStrategy backoffStrategy)
        Parameters:
        backoffStrategy - backoff strategy to use for this consumer

      • withExpirationStrategy

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withExpirationStrategy(ExpirationStrategy expirationStrategy)
        Parameters:
        expirationStrategy - Strategy to determine if a message has expired before it is processed

      • withPriority

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withPriority(int priority)
        Parameters:
        priority - A consumer with a higher priority (lower value) will have messages processed first (0 is the highest priority)

      • withShutdownTimeout

        public SqsConsumerBuilder<T> withShutdownTimeout(Duration shutdownTimeout)
